::Prowl::

Prowl looks a bit sadly at the blank pod, something nagging at him. 
Did the Maximals have a spare spark somewhere? He could almost swear 
they did...

Prowl shakes out of his trance as Iron Raptor nuges him on the 
shoulder, a bit of pain shooting through him. He looks at her snout 
on his shoulder, his eyes melting into a look of love. He loved her, 
no matter what form she was in.

Nodding, Prowl walks to the side of Iron Raptor, mounting her again. 
He leans down, kissing her before whispering into her ear: "I love 
you, no matter what form you are in."



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> * Iron Raptor watches Prowl jump from her back and walk over to the 
pod, her 
> pradictions right at the lack of movement.
> It was a blank, a protoform without a spark.
> She sighed, disappointed as well as Prowl. The Maximal forces could 
have 
> used another player in this war, but it was just as well. One less 
soul 
> which would be damned to fight a war on a losing side. One less 
spark to 
> join the Matrix.
> 
> Iron Raptor them looked off across the plain, the large orange sun 
just 
> touching the horizon.
> She stepped towards the sun, the direction of the Ark.*
> 
> " We had better get moving then..."
> 
> * She then turned and looked over at Prowl, seeing the stump of his 
wing, 
> wondering about just when he had ripped it off.
> She sidled up beside him and nudged his shoulder with her snout, 
concern 
> obviouse in her voice.*
> 
> " You alright?"
> 
> * She made a rough purring sound, cross betqeen a soft snarl and a 
low 
> growl, her snout pressed to the back of Prowls shoulder, the only 
real 
> action of affection since she had taken this twist in life.*
